description: Coupled ocean-atmosphere time slice experiment forced by climatological monthly mean sea surface temperature (SST) for the present day and pre-industrial Actic sea ice concentration (SIC). Sea ice concentration to be nudged into coupled model with a relaxation time-scale of 1 day. Radiative forcing to be set to present day (year 2000) levels.  Initial conditions for coupled model experiments to be taken from year 2000 of coupled model CMIP6 historical simulations. Time slice simulations to begin on 1st April and run for 14 months, the first two months are ignored to allow for an initial model spin up. Minimum ensemble size is 100 simulations.
long_name: Partially-coupled time slice constrained by pre-industrial Arctic SIC
rationale: Investigate response to Arctic sea ice in coupled model.
